name: Courthouse Square (Universal Backlot)
description: A famous Hollywood backlot used for numerous film and TV productions.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Courthouse Square, located within the Universal Studios Hollywood backlot, is a well-known outdoor set used in a variety of films and television productions. Its most iconic feature is the courthouse building, which has been depicted as various fictional locations in different time periods.

content.title: Film History
content.body: Courthouse Square is famously known for its role as the Hill Valley town square in the *Back to the Future* film series. It served as the backdrop for notable scenes including Marty McFly's time-travel escapades. Beyond *Back to the Future*, the location has also been used in films such as *To Kill a Mockingbird* and TV series like *The Twilight Zone*.

content.title: Visiting
content.body: While Courthouse Square is part of an active studio lot, it is accessible to the public through Universal Studios Hollywood's Studio Tour. Visitors can often see the square and other famous sets during guided tours.
